00024 TEST(State, Basic) {
00025   State state;
00026   Rule* rule = new Rule("cat");
00027   string err;
00028   EXPECT_TRUE(rule->ParseCommand("cat $in > $out", &err));
00029   ASSERT_EQ("", err);
00030   state.AddRule(rule);
00031   Edge* edge = state.AddEdge(rule);
00032   state.AddIn(edge, "in1");
00033   state.AddIn(edge, "in2");
00034   state.AddOut(edge, "out");
00035 
00036   EXPECT_EQ("cat in1 in2 > out", edge->EvaluateCommand());
00037 
00038   EXPECT_FALSE(state.GetNode("in1")->dirty());
00039   EXPECT_FALSE(state.GetNode("in2")->dirty());
00040   EXPECT_FALSE(state.GetNode("out")->dirty());
00041 }
00042 
00043 struct TestEnv : public Env {
00044   virtual string LookupVariable(const string& var) {
00045     return vars[var];
00046   }
00047   map<string, string> vars;
00048 };
00049 TEST(EvalString, PlainText) {
00050   EvalString str;
00051   string err;
00052   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("plain text", &err));
00053   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00054   EXPECT_EQ("plain text", str.Evaluate(NULL));
00055 }
00056 TEST(EvalString, OneVariable) {
00057   EvalString str;
00058   string err;
00059   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("hi $var", &err));
00060   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00061   EXPECT_EQ("hi $var", str.unparsed());
00062   TestEnv env;
00063   EXPECT_EQ("hi ", str.Evaluate(&env));
00064   env.vars["var"] = "there";
00065   EXPECT_EQ("hi there", str.Evaluate(&env));
00066 }
00067 TEST(EvalString, OneVariableUpperCase) {
00068   EvalString str;
00069   string err;
00070   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("hi $VaR", &err));
00071   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00072   EXPECT_EQ("hi $VaR", str.unparsed());
00073   TestEnv env;
00074   EXPECT_EQ("hi ", str.Evaluate(&env));
00075   env.vars["VaR"] = "there";
00076   EXPECT_EQ("hi there", str.Evaluate(&env));
00077 }
00078 TEST(EvalString, Error) {
00079   EvalString str;
00080   string err;
00081   size_t err_index;
00082   EXPECT_FALSE(str.Parse("bad $", &err, &err_index));
00083   EXPECT_EQ("expected variable after $", err);
00084   EXPECT_EQ(5, err_index);
00085 }
00086 TEST(EvalString, CurlyError) {
00087   EvalString str;
00088   string err;
00089   size_t err_index;
00090   EXPECT_FALSE(str.Parse("bad ${bar", &err, &err_index));
00091   EXPECT_EQ("expected closing curly after ${", err);
00092   EXPECT_EQ(9, err_index);
00093 }
00094 TEST(EvalString, Curlies) {
00095   EvalString str;
00096   string err;
00097   EXPECT_TRUE(str.Parse("foo ${var}baz", &err));
00098   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00099   TestEnv env;
00100   EXPECT_EQ("foo baz", str.Evaluate(&env));
00101   env.vars["var"] = "barbar";
00102   EXPECT_EQ("foo barbarbaz", str.Evaluate(&env));
00103 }

00105 struct StatTest : public StateTestWithBuiltinRules,
00106                   public DiskInterface {
00107   // DiskInterface implementation.
00108   virtual int Stat(const string& path);
00109   virtual bool MakeDir(const string& path) {
00110     assert(false);
00111     return false;
00112   }
00113   virtual string ReadFile(const string& path, string* err) {
00114     assert(false);
00115     return "";
00116   }
00117 
00118   map<string, time_t> mtimes_;
00119   vector<string> stats_;
00120 };
00121 
00122 int StatTest::Stat(const string& path) {
00123   stats_.push_back(path);
00124   map<string, time_t>::iterator i = mtimes_.find(path);
00125   if (i == mtimes_.end())
00126     return 0;  // File not found.
00127   return i->second;
00128 }
00129 
00130 TEST_F(StatTest, Simple) {
00131   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00132 "build out: cat in\n"));
00133 
00134   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00135   out->file_->Stat(this);
00136   ASSERT_EQ(1, stats_.size());
00137   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00138   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00139   ASSERT_EQ(2, stats_.size());
00140   ASSERT_EQ("out", stats_[0]);
00141   ASSERT_EQ("in",  stats_[1]);
00142 }
00143 
00144 TEST_F(StatTest, TwoStep) {
00145   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00146 "build out: cat mid\n"
00147 "build mid: cat in\n"));
00148 
00149   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00150   out->file_->Stat(this);
00151   ASSERT_EQ(1, stats_.size());
00152   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00153   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00154   ASSERT_EQ(3, stats_.size());
00155   ASSERT_EQ("out", stats_[0]);
00156   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("out")->dirty_);
00157   ASSERT_EQ("mid",  stats_[1]);
00158   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("mid")->dirty_);
00159   ASSERT_EQ("in",  stats_[2]);
00160 }
00161 
00162 TEST_F(StatTest, Tree) {
00163   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00164 "build out: cat mid1 mid2\n"
00165 "build mid1: cat in11 in12\n"
00166 "build mid2: cat in21 in22\n"));
00167 
00168   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00169   out->file_->Stat(this);
00170   ASSERT_EQ(1, stats_.size());
00171   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00172   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00173   ASSERT_EQ(1 + 6, stats_.size());
00174   ASSERT_EQ("mid1", stats_[1]);
00175   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("mid1")->dirty_);
00176   ASSERT_EQ("in11", stats_[2]);
00177 }
00178 
00179 TEST_F(StatTest, Middle) {
00180   ASSERT_NO_FATAL_FAILURE(AssertParse(&state_,
00181 "build out: cat mid\n"
00182 "build mid: cat in\n"));
00183 
00184   mtimes_["in"] = 1;
00185   mtimes_["mid"] = 0;  // missing
00186   mtimes_["out"] = 1;
00187 
00188   Node* out = GetNode("out");
00189   out->file_->Stat(this);
00190   ASSERT_EQ(1, stats_.size());
00191   Edge* edge = out->in_edge_;
00192   edge->RecomputeDirty(NULL, this, NULL);
00193   ASSERT_FALSE(GetNode("in")->dirty_);
00194   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("mid")->dirty_);
00195   ASSERT_TRUE(GetNode("out")->dirty_);
00196 }

00198 class DiskInterfaceTest : public testing::Test {
00199 public:
00200   virtual void SetUp() {
00201     char buf[4 << 10];
00202     ASSERT_TRUE(getcwd(buf, sizeof(buf)));
00203     start_dir_ = buf;
00204 
00205     const char* tempdir = getenv("TMPDIR");
00206     if (!tempdir)
00207       tempdir = "/tmp";
00208     ASSERT_EQ(0, chdir(tempdir));
00209 
00210     char name_template[] = "DiskInterfaceTest-XXXXXX";
00211     char* name = mkdtemp(name_template);
00212     temp_dir_name_ = name;
00213     ASSERT_TRUE(name);
00214     ASSERT_EQ(0, chdir(name));
00215   }
00216   virtual void TearDown() {
00217     ASSERT_EQ(0, chdir(start_dir_.c_str()));
00218     ASSERT_EQ(0, system(("rm -rf " + temp_dir_name_).c_str()));
00219   }
00220 
00221   string start_dir_;
00222   string temp_dir_name_;
00223   RealDiskInterface disk_;
00224 };
00225 
00226 TEST_F(DiskInterfaceTest, Stat) {
00227   EXPECT_EQ(0, disk_.Stat("nosuchfile"));
00228 
00229   string too_long_name(512, 'x');
00230   EXPECT_EQ(-1, disk_.Stat(too_long_name));
00231 
00232   ASSERT_EQ(0, system("touch file"));
00233   EXPECT_GT(disk_.Stat("file"), 1);
00234 }
00235 
00236 TEST_F(DiskInterfaceTest, ReadFile) {
00237   string err;
00238   EXPECT_EQ("", disk_.ReadFile("foobar", &err));
00239   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00240 
00241   const char* kTestFile = "testfile";
00242   FILE* f = fopen(kTestFile, "wb");
00243   ASSERT_TRUE(f);
00244   const char* kTestContent = "test content\nok";
00245   fprintf(f, "%s", kTestContent);
00246   ASSERT_EQ(0, fclose(f));
00247 
00248   EXPECT_EQ(kTestContent, disk_.ReadFile(kTestFile, &err));
00249   EXPECT_EQ("", err);
00250 }
00251 
00252 TEST_F(DiskInterfaceTest, MakeDirs) {
00253   EXPECT_TRUE(disk_.MakeDirs("path/with/double//slash/"));
00254 }
